text: The Archaeological Museum of Aegina is a museum in Aegina, Greece.right Founded in 1828 by Ioannis Kapodistrias, the first governor of independent Greece, the museum contains a variety of ancient vessels, pottery, ceramics, alabasters, statuettes, inscriptions, coins, weapons and copper vessels.www.aegina.com These objects are located in 3 rooms in which are all the exhibits. One of the artifacts of the museum, an etched carnelian bead, a typical Harappan object, points to ancient trade relations with Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley Civilization. ==References== ==External links== *www.aegina.com *Ministry of Culture and Tourism Aegina Category:Museums established in 1828 Category:1828 establishments in Greece Category:Ioannis Kapodistrias
title: Archaeological Museum of Aegina
